entry.title: John McCaffary House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the John McCaffary House (pictured) was the site of the 1850 murder of Bridget McCaffary, for which John McCaffary became the first and only person to be executed by the state of Wisconsin?

entry.title: The Australian Wars (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 2022 documentary The Australian Wars explores "the great Australian silence" about massacres of Indigenous Australians?

entry.title: A Fistful of Gun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Devolver Digital published A Fistful of Gun after its developer jokingly suggested a collaboration?

entry.title: John Rauch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that John Rauch, of the firm Venturi, Rauch & Scott Brown, was called "one of the unsung heroes of postwar American architecture" by the Architectural Record?

entry.title: Informer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Informer released a portable computer terminal that also doubled as an IBM PC compatible?

entry.title: a retired brigadier general (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 2010 the Indonesian National Armed Forces brought a retired brigadier general before a military tribunal over a land dispute?

entry.title: Liberty Theatre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although the Liberty Theatre was built in 1904 to host the Rogers Brothers' musicals, the brothers made their last appearance there three years later?

entry.title: Korey Foreman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Korey Foreman held a makeshift raffle to decide where to play college football?
